title: Veerendra Heggade
text:
D. Veerendra Heggade (born 25 November 1948) is an Indian philanthropist and the hereditary administrator/Dharmadhikari of the <a href="Dharmasthala%20Temple">Dharmasthala Temple</a>. He succeeded to the post at the age of 19, on 24 October 1968, the 21st in his line. He administers the temple and its properties, which are held in the trust for the benefit of devotees and of <a href="Dharma">Dharma</a>.
He has received multiple awards for his numerous contributions. He was awarded the <a href="Karnataka%20Ratna">Karnataka Ratna</a> award for the year 2009, the highest civilian award in <a href="Karnataka">Karnataka</a>.
Personal life.
Heggade was born the eldest son of Dharmadhikari <a href="Ratnavarma%20Heggade">Ratnavarma Heggade</a> and Rathnamma Heggade (née Shetty). He belongs to the Pergade dynasty of <a href="Tulu%20people">Tulu</a> Lineage, the hereditary trustees of the famous Sri <a href="Dharmasthala">Dharmasthala</a> <a href="Dharmasthala%20Temple">Manjunatha Swamy temple</a> in <a href="South%20Kannada">South Kannada</a> district of <a href="Karnataka">Karnataka</a>. The family are trustees of a <a href="Hindu">Hindu</a> temple, although the family are of the <a href="Jain%20Bunt">Jain Bunt</a> community. They belong to the Digambara Jain. He has three younger brothers, Harshendra Kumar, Surendra Kumar and Rajendra Kumar, and a sister, Padmalata. He married Hemavathi Heggade in a match arranged by their parents. Veerendra Heggade and Hemavathy Heggadthi are the parents of daughter Shraddha.
As the eldest son, Veerendra Heggade succeeded his father as "Dharmadhikari". He is the twenty-first member of the "Pergade" dynasty to hold the position of "Dharmadhikari" of the <a href="Dharmasthala%20Temple">Dharmasthala Temple</a>. As he has no sons, his heir is his younger brother, Harshendra.
Dharmadhikari Veerendra Heggade is a car collector and photography aficionado. His car collection is on display in Dharmastala.
